Q: Why does the Tkinter canvas-enter event behave differently in Windows 11 and Linux Mint? A:

I'm under windows 11 and have the exact same behavior as you stated under linux mint. Which is logical

-> `<Enter-Frame>`-> `<Leave-Frame>` -> `<Leave-Canvas>`-> `<Leave-Window>`
-> `<Enter-Window>` -> `<Enter-Canvas>`

That been said, it's entirely up to the window manager of the OS to post such Events, tkinter does not generate them, tkinter respond to the events.

How can I avoid such problems?

It's not clear what you try to accomplish. Generally speaking, it's a sign of bad code if you over and over bind and unbind events. Extract the important information of the event and handle it the way you want.

Q: Is there any way to generate screenshot of a youtube video from a specific time? A:

In August 2023, Google released an option to copy and save a clean frame from any YouTube or Google Photos video on the web.

Get screenshot from YouTube video at a specific time

  1. Open a YouTube video in Google Chrome (desktop)
  2. Play any video.
  3. Pause the video at the exact timestamp you want.
  4. Double right‑click on the video player.

    the first right‑click opens YouTube’s own menu, the second opens Chrome’s menu

  5. Select Save video frame as... from the Chrome context menu.

    Chrome will save the current frame as a PNG file in your downloads folder.

ㅤ

Availability:

This feature is rolling out in recent versions of Chrome.

If you don’t see it yet, update Chrome.
